text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires distinguishing between seeking Damages (monetary compensation) and an Account of Profits (claiming the money the infringer made). The candidate answer mentions 'Damages: Actual (lost sales), account of profits, or statutory (up to \u00a310k+ per work). Injunction to stop model use/sales.' While it lists 'account of profits' as an option, it does not clearly distinguish or explain the difference between seeking damages (which compensates the claimant for their loss) versus an account of profits (which strips the infringer of their gain). It merely lists them as potential remedies without fulfilling the core requirement of distinguishing between the two concepts.", "criterion_id": "615bd4d9-0d5d-41e1-9cac-6218986f566e"}
